title: OsamaSon Shares New Video for “Ref”: Watch
description: The Jump Out song gets a surrealist action visual directed by Walker Andrews
author: Nina Corcoran
excerpt: The Jump Out song gets a surrealist action visual directed by Walker Andrews
text: The Jump Out song gets a surrealist action visual directed by Walker AndrewsOsamaSon has shared a new music video for his Jump Out song “Ref.” The album highlight now gets a surrealist action visual courtesy of director Walker Andrews. In it, the SoundCloud rapper brings his song, and album cover, to life with red-lit women crawling towards him on a bed, and other shots of OsamaSon rapping along to the track in a ring of lights, standing before a vertical sports car, and more. Watch it below.The Charleston, South Carolina-based rapper released Jump Out back in January. His third full-length LP fueled by blown-out beats and EDM rage, it followed his earlier records in Flex Musix and Osama Season in 2023. OsamaSon also teamed up with Younotsupposedtobehere for the Christian Boultan EP and Boolymon for the Still Slime EP last year.Read Kieran Press-Reynolds’ interview “OsamaSon, Bass-Boosted to the Big Leagues” and catch Jump Out in the list “The Best Music of 2025 So Far.”Nina Corcoran joined Pitchfork as an Associate Staff Writer in 2021 after contributing to the website since 2015. She’s written for Rolling Stone, Wired, NPR, Stereogum, and elsewhere, and was previously the music editor of alt-weekly newspaper DigBoston. She’s based in Chicago. ... Read more
html:
The Jump Out song gets a surrealist action visual directed by Walker Andrews

OsamaSon has shared a new music video for his Jump Out song “Ref.” The album highlight now gets a surrealist action visual courtesy of director Walker Andrews. In it, the SoundCloud rapper brings his song, and album cover, to life with red-lit women crawling towards him on a bed, and other shots of OsamaSon rapping along to the track in a ring of lights, standing before a vertical sports car, and more. Watch it below.

The Charleston, South Carolina-based rapper released Jump Out back in January. His third full-length LP fueled by blown-out beats and EDM rage, it followed his earlier records in Flex Musix and Osama Season in 2023. OsamaSon also teamed up with Younotsupposedtobehere for the Christian Boultan EP and Boolymon for the Still Slime EP last year.

Read Kieran Press-Reynolds’ interview “OsamaSon, Bass-Boosted to the Big Leagues” and catch Jump Out in the list “The Best Music of 2025 So Far.”

Nina Corcoran joined Pitchfork as an Associate Staff Writer in 2021 after contributing to the website since 2015. She’s written for Rolling Stone, Wired, NPR, Stereogum, and elsewhere, and was previously the music editor of alt-weekly newspaper DigBoston. She’s based in Chicago. ... Read more
